33enum class Command
34{
35 Blit,
36 Clear,
37 CopyImage,
38 Dispatch,
39 Draw,
40 GenerateMipmap,
41 ReadPixels,
42 TexImage,
43 Other
44};

46enum class InitState
47{
48 MayNeedInit,
49 Initialized,
50};
51
52struct Rectangle
53{
54 Rectangle() : x(0), y(0), width(0), height(0) {}
55 constexpr Rectangle(int x_in, int y_in, int width_in, int height_in)
56 : x(x_in), y(y_in), width(width_in), height(height_in)
57 {}
58
59 int x0() const { return x; }
60 int y0() const { return y; }
61 int x1() const { return x + width; }
62 int y1() const { return y + height; }
63
64 bool isReversedX() const { return width < 0; }
65 bool isReversedY() const { return height < 0; }
66
67 // Returns a rectangle with the same area but flipped in X, Y, neither or both.
68 Rectangle flip(bool flipX, bool flipY) const;
69
70 // Returns a rectangle with the same area but with height and width guaranteed to be positive.
71 Rectangle removeReversal() const;
72
73 bool encloses(const gl::Rectangle &inside) const;
74
75 bool empty() const { return width == 0 && height == 0; }
76
77 int x;
78 int y;
79 int width;
80 int height;
81};
82
83bool operator==(const Rectangle &a, const Rectangle &b);
84bool operator!=(const Rectangle &a, const Rectangle &b);
85
86// Calculate the intersection of two rectangles. Returns false if the intersection is empty.
87ANGLE_NO_DISCARD bool ClipRectangle(const Rectangle &source,
88 const Rectangle &clip,
89 Rectangle *intersection);
90// Calculate the smallest rectangle that covers both rectangles. This rectangle may cover areas
91// not covered by the two rectangles, for example in this situation:
92//
93// +--+ +----+
94// | ++-+ -> | |
95// +-++ | | |
96// +--+ +----+
97//
98void GetEnclosingRectangle(const Rectangle &rect1, const Rectangle &rect2, Rectangle *rectUnion);
99// Extend the source rectangle to cover parts (or all of) the second rectangle, in such a way that
100// no area is covered that isn't covered by both rectangles. For example:
101//
102// +--+ +--+
103// source --> | | | |
104// ++--+-+ -> | |
105// |+--+ | | |
106// +-----+ +--+
107//
108void ExtendRectangle(const Rectangle &source, const Rectangle &extend, Rectangle *extended);
109
110struct Offset
111{
112 constexpr Offset() : x(0), y(0), z(0) {}
113 constexpr Offset(int x_in, int y_in, int z_in) : x(x_in), y(y_in), z(z_in) {}
114
115 int x;
116 int y;
117 int z;
118};
119
120constexpr Offset kOffsetZero(0, 0, 0);
121
122bool operator==(const Offset &a, const Offset &b);
123bool operator!=(const Offset &a, const Offset &b);
124
125struct Extents
126{
127 Extents() : width(0), height(0), depth(0) {}
128 Extents(int width_, int height_, int depth_) : width(width_), height(height_), depth(depth_) {}
129
130 Extents(const Extents &other) = default;
131 Extents &operator=(const Extents &other) = default;
132
133 bool empty() const { return (width * height * depth) == 0; }
134
135 int width;
136 int height;
137 int depth;
138};
139
140bool operator==(const Extents &lhs, const Extents &rhs);
141bool operator!=(const Extents &lhs, const Extents &rhs);
142
143struct Box
144{
145 Box() : x(0), y(0), z(0), width(0), height(0), depth(0) {}
146 Box(int x_in, int y_in, int z_in, int width_in, int height_in, int depth_in)
147 : x(x_in), y(y_in), z(z_in), width(width_in), height(height_in), depth(depth_in)
148 {}
149 template <typename O, typename E>
150 Box(const O &offset, const E &size)
151 : x(offset.x),
152 y(offset.y),
153 z(offset.z),
154 width(size.width),
155 height(size.height),
156 depth(size.depth)
157 {}
158 bool operator==(const Box &other) const;
159 bool operator!=(const Box &other) const;
160 Rectangle toRect() const;
161
162 // Whether the Box has offset 0 and the same extents as argument.
163 bool coversSameExtent(const Extents &size) const;
164
165 int x;
166 int y;
167 int z;
168 int width;
169 int height;
170 int depth;
171};

194};

255// Packs a sampler state for completeness checks:
256// * minFilter: 5 values (3 bits)
257// * magFilter: 2 values (1 bit)
258// * wrapS: 3 values (2 bits)
259// * wrapT: 3 values (2 bits)
260// * compareMode: 1 bit (for == GL_NONE).
261// This makes a total of 9 bits. We can pack this easily into 32 bits:
262// * minFilter: 8 bits
263// * magFilter: 8 bits
264// * wrapS: 8 bits
265// * wrapT: 4 bits
266// * compareMode: 4 bits
267
268struct PackedSamplerCompleteness
269{
270 uint8_t minFilter;
271 uint8_t magFilter;
272 uint8_t wrapS;
273 uint8_t wrapTCompareMode;
274};
275
276static_assert(sizeof(PackedSamplerCompleteness) == sizeof(uint32_t), "Unexpected size");
277
278// State from Table 6.10 (state per sampler object)
279class SamplerState final
280{
281 public:
282 // This will zero-initialize the struct, including padding.
283 SamplerState();
284 SamplerState(const SamplerState &other);
285
286 SamplerState &operator=(const SamplerState &other);
287
288 static SamplerState CreateDefaultForTarget(TextureType type);
289
290 GLenum getMinFilter() const { return mMinFilter; }
291
292 void setMinFilter(GLenum minFilter);
293
294 GLenum getMagFilter() const { return mMagFilter; }
295
296 void setMagFilter(GLenum magFilter);
297
298 GLenum getWrapS() const { return mWrapS; }
299
300 void setWrapS(GLenum wrapS);
301
302 GLenum getWrapT() const { return mWrapT; }
303
304 void setWrapT(GLenum wrapT);
305
306 GLenum getWrapR() const { return mWrapR; }
307
308 void setWrapR(GLenum wrapR);
309
310 float getMaxAnisotropy() const { return mMaxAnisotropy; }
311
312 void setMaxAnisotropy(float maxAnisotropy);
313
314 GLfloat getMinLod() const { return mMinLod; }
315
316 void setMinLod(GLfloat minLod);
317
318 GLfloat getMaxLod() const { return mMaxLod; }
319
320 void setMaxLod(GLfloat maxLod);
321
322 GLenum getCompareMode() const { return mCompareMode; }
323
324 void setCompareMode(GLenum compareMode);
325
326 GLenum getCompareFunc() const { return mCompareFunc; }
327
328 void setCompareFunc(GLenum compareFunc);
329
330 GLenum getSRGBDecode() const { return mSRGBDecode; }
331
332 void setSRGBDecode(GLenum sRGBDecode);
333
334 void setBorderColor(const ColorGeneric &color);
335
336 const ColorGeneric &getBorderColor() const { return mBorderColor; }
337
338 bool sameCompleteness(const SamplerState &samplerState) const
339 {
340 return mCompleteness.packed == samplerState.mCompleteness.packed;
341 }
342
343 private:
344 void updateWrapTCompareMode();
345
346 GLenum mMinFilter;
347 GLenum mMagFilter;
348
349 GLenum mWrapS;
350 GLenum mWrapT;
351 GLenum mWrapR;
352
353 // From EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic
354 float mMaxAnisotropy;
355
356 GLfloat mMinLod;
357 GLfloat mMaxLod;
358
359 GLenum mCompareMode;
360 GLenum mCompareFunc;
361
362 GLenum mSRGBDecode;
363
364 ColorGeneric mBorderColor;
365
366 union Completeness
367 {
368 uint32_t packed;
369 PackedSamplerCompleteness typed;
370 };
371
372 Completeness mCompleteness;
373};
374
375bool operator==(const SamplerState &a, const SamplerState &b);
376bool operator!=(const SamplerState &a, const SamplerState &b);

433// Used in Program and VertexArray.
434using AttributesMask = angle::BitSet<MAX_VERTEX_ATTRIBS>;
435
436// Used in Program
437using UniformBlockBindingMask = angle::BitSet<IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_COMBINED_SHADER_UNIFORM_BUFFERS>;
438
439// Used in Framebuffer / Program
440using DrawBufferMask = angle::BitSet8<IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS>;
441
442class BlendStateExt final
443{
444 static_assert(IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS == 8, "Only up to 8 draw buffers supported.");
445
446 public:
447 template <typename ElementType, size_t ElementCount>
448 struct StorageType final
449 {
450 static_assert(ElementCount <= 256, "ElementCount cannot exceed 256.");
451
452#if defined(ANGLE_IS_64_BIT_CPU)
453 // Always use uint64_t on 64-bit systems
454 static constexpr size_t kBits = 8;
455#else
456 static constexpr size_t kBits = ElementCount > 16 ? 8 : 4;
457#endif
458
459 using Type = typename std::conditional<kBits == 8, uint64_t, uint32_t>::type;
460
461 static constexpr Type kMaxValueMask = (kBits == 8) ? 0xFF : 0xF;
462
463 static constexpr Type GetMask(const size_t drawBuffers)
464 {
465 ASSERT(drawBuffers > 0);
466 ASSERT(drawBuffers <= IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS);
467 return static_cast<Type>(0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFull >> (64 - drawBuffers * kBits));
468 }
469
470 // A multiplier that is used to replicate 4- or 8-bit value 8 times.
471 static constexpr Type kReplicator = (kBits == 8) ? 0x0101010101010101ull : 0x11111111;
472
473 // Extract packed `Bits`-bit value of index `index`. `values` variable contains up to 8
474 // packed values.
475 static constexpr ElementType GetValueIndexed(const size_t index, const Type values)
476 {
477 ASSERT(index < IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS);
478
479 return static_cast<ElementType>((values >> (index * kBits)) & kMaxValueMask);
480 }
481
482 // Replicate `Bits`-bit value 8 times and mask the result.
483 static constexpr Type GetReplicatedValue(const ElementType value, const Type mask)
484 {
485 ASSERT(static_cast<size_t>(value) <= kMaxValueMask);
486 return (static_cast<size_t>(value) * kReplicator) & mask;
487 }
488
489 // Replace `Bits`-bit value of index `index` in `target` with `value`.
490 static constexpr void SetValueIndexed(const size_t index,
491 const ElementType value,
492 Type *target)
493 {
494 ASSERT(static_cast<size_t>(value) <= kMaxValueMask);
495 ASSERT(index < IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS);
496
497 // Bitmask with set bits that contain the value of index `index`.
498 const Type selector = kMaxValueMask << (index * kBits);
499
500 // Shift the new `value` to its position in the packed value.
501 const Type builtValue = static_cast<Type>(value) << (index * kBits);
502
503 // Mark differing bits of `target` and `builtValue`, then flip the bits on those
504 // positions in `target`.
505 // Taken from https://graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html#MaskedMerge
506 *target = *target ^ ((*target ^ builtValue) & selector);
507 }
508
509 // Compare two packed sets of eight 4-bit values and return an 8-bit diff mask.
510 static constexpr DrawBufferMask GetDiffMask(const uint32_t packedValue1,
511 const uint32_t packedValue2)
512 {
513 uint32_t diff = packedValue1 ^ packedValue2;
514
515 // For each 4-bit value that is different between inputs, set the msb to 1 and other
516 // bits to 0.
517 diff = (diff | ((diff & 0x77777777) + 0x77777777)) & 0x88888888;
518
519 // By this point, `diff` looks like a...b...c...d...e...f...g...h... (dots mean zeros).
520 // To get DrawBufferMask, we need to compress this 32-bit value to 8 bits, i.e. abcdefgh
521
522 // Multiplying the lower half of `diff` by 0x249 (0x200 + 0x40 + 0x8 + 0x1) produces:
523 // ................e...f...g...h... +
524 // .............e...f...g...h...... +
525 // ..........e...f...g...h......... +
526 // .......e...f...g...h............
527 // ________________________________ =
528 // .......e..ef.efgefghfgh.gh..h...
529 // ^^^^
530 // Similar operation is applied to the upper word.
531 // This calculation could be replaced with a single PEXT instruction from BMI2 set.
532 diff = ((((diff & 0xFFFF0000) * 0x249) >> 24) & 0xF0) | (((diff * 0x249) >> 12) & 0xF);
533
534 return DrawBufferMask(static_cast<uint8_t>(diff));
535 }
536
537 // Compare two packed sets of eight 8-bit values and return an 8-bit diff mask.
538 static constexpr DrawBufferMask GetDiffMask(const uint64_t packedValue1,
539 const uint64_t packedValue2)
540 {
541 uint64_t diff = packedValue1 ^ packedValue2;
542
543 // For each 8-bit value that is different between inputs, set the msb to 1 and other
544 // bits to 0.
545 diff = (diff | ((diff & 0x7F7F7F7F7F7F7F7F) + 0x7F7F7F7F7F7F7F7F)) & 0x8080808080808080;
546
547 // By this point, `diff` looks like (dots mean zeros):
548 // a.......b.......c.......d.......e.......f.......g.......h.......
549 // To get DrawBufferMask, we need to compress this 64-bit value to 8 bits, i.e. abcdefgh
550
551 // Multiplying `diff` by 0x0002040810204081 produces:
552 // a.......b.......c.......d.......e.......f.......g.......h....... +
553 // .b.......c.......d.......e.......f.......g.......h.............. +
554 // ..c.......d.......e.......f.......g.......h..................... +
555 // ...d.......e.......f.......g.......h............................ +
556 // ....e.......f.......g.......h................................... +
557 // .....f.......g.......h.......................................... +
558 // ......g.......h................................................. +
559 // .......h........................................................
560 // ________________________________________________________________ =
561 // abcdefghbcdefgh.cdefgh..defgh...efgh....fgh.....gh......h.......
562 // ^^^^^^^^
563 // This operation could be replaced with a single PEXT instruction from BMI2 set.
564 diff = 0x0002040810204081 * diff >> 56;
565
566 return DrawBufferMask(static_cast<uint8_t>(diff));
567 }
568 };
569
570 using FactorStorage = StorageType<BlendFactorType, angle::EnumSize<BlendFactorType>()>;
571 using EquationStorage = StorageType<BlendEquationType, angle::EnumSize<BlendEquationType>()>;
572 using ColorMaskStorage = StorageType<uint8_t, 16>;
573
574 BlendStateExt(const size_t drawBuffers = 1);
575
576 BlendStateExt &operator=(const BlendStateExt &other);
577
578 ///////// Blending Toggle /////////
579
580 void setEnabled(const bool enabled);
581 void setEnabledIndexed(const size_t index, const bool enabled);
582
583 ///////// Color Write Mask /////////
584
585 static constexpr size_t PackColorMask(const bool red,
586 const bool green,
587 const bool blue,
588 const bool alpha)
589 {
590 return (red ? 1 : 0) | (green ? 2 : 0) | (blue ? 4 : 0) | (alpha ? 8 : 0);
591 }
592
593 static constexpr void UnpackColorMask(const size_t value,
594 bool *red,
595 bool *green,
596 bool *blue,
597 bool *alpha)
598 {
599 *red = static_cast<bool>(value & 1);
600 *green = static_cast<bool>(value & 2);
601 *blue = static_cast<bool>(value & 4);
602 *alpha = static_cast<bool>(value & 8);
603 }
604
605 ColorMaskStorage::Type expandColorMaskValue(const bool red,
606 const bool green,
607 const bool blue,
608 const bool alpha) const;
609 ColorMaskStorage::Type expandColorMaskIndexed(const size_t index) const;
610 void setColorMask(const bool red, const bool green, const bool blue, const bool alpha);
611 void setColorMaskIndexed(const size_t index, const uint8_t value);
612 void setColorMaskIndexed(const size_t index,
613 const bool red,
614 const bool green,
615 const bool blue,
616 const bool alpha);
617 uint8_t getColorMaskIndexed(const size_t index) const;
618 void getColorMaskIndexed(const size_t index,
619 bool *red,
620 bool *green,
621 bool *blue,
622 bool *alpha) const;
623 DrawBufferMask compareColorMask(ColorMaskStorage::Type other) const;
624
625 ///////// Blend Equation /////////
626
627 EquationStorage::Type expandEquationValue(const GLenum mode) const;
628 EquationStorage::Type expandEquationColorIndexed(const size_t index) const;
629 EquationStorage::Type expandEquationAlphaIndexed(const size_t index) const;
630 void setEquations(const GLenum modeColor, const GLenum modeAlpha);
631 void setEquationsIndexed(const size_t index, const GLenum modeColor, const GLenum modeAlpha);
632 void setEquationsIndexed(const size_t index,
633 const size_t otherIndex,
634 const BlendStateExt &other);
635 GLenum getEquationColorIndexed(size_t index) const;
636 GLenum getEquationAlphaIndexed(size_t index) const;
637 DrawBufferMask compareEquations(const EquationStorage::Type color,
638 const EquationStorage::Type alpha) const;
639
640 ///////// Blend Factors /////////
641
642 FactorStorage::Type expandFactorValue(const GLenum func) const;
643 FactorStorage::Type expandSrcColorIndexed(const size_t index) const;
644 FactorStorage::Type expandDstColorIndexed(const size_t index) const;
645 FactorStorage::Type expandSrcAlphaIndexed(const size_t index) const;
646 FactorStorage::Type expandDstAlphaIndexed(const size_t index) const;
647 void setFactors(const GLenum srcColor,
648 const GLenum dstColor,
649 const GLenum srcAlpha,
650 const GLenum dstAlpha);
651 void setFactorsIndexed(const size_t index,
652 const GLenum srcColor,
653 const GLenum dstColor,
654 const GLenum srcAlpha,
655 const GLenum dstAlpha);
656 void setFactorsIndexed(const size_t index, const size_t otherIndex, const BlendStateExt &other);
657 GLenum getSrcColorIndexed(size_t index) const;
658 GLenum getDstColorIndexed(size_t index) const;
659 GLenum getSrcAlphaIndexed(size_t index) const;
660 GLenum getDstAlphaIndexed(size_t index) const;
661 DrawBufferMask compareFactors(const FactorStorage::Type srcColor,
662 const FactorStorage::Type dstColor,
663 const FactorStorage::Type srcAlpha,
664 const FactorStorage::Type dstAlpha) const;
665
666 ///////// Data Members /////////
667
668 const FactorStorage::Type mMaxFactorMask;
669 FactorStorage::Type mSrcColor;
670 FactorStorage::Type mDstColor;
671 FactorStorage::Type mSrcAlpha;
672 FactorStorage::Type mDstAlpha;
673
674 const EquationStorage::Type mMaxEquationMask;
675 EquationStorage::Type mEquationColor;
676 EquationStorage::Type mEquationAlpha;
677
678 const ColorMaskStorage::Type mMaxColorMask;
679 ColorMaskStorage::Type mColorMask;
680
681 const DrawBufferMask mMaxEnabledMask;
682 DrawBufferMask mEnabledMask;
683
684 const size_t mMaxDrawBuffers;
685};
686
687// Used in StateCache
688using StorageBuffersMask = angle::BitSet<IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_SHADER_STORAGE_BUFFER_BINDINGS>;
689
690template <typename T>
691using TexLevelArray = std::array<T, IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_TEXTURE_LEVELS>;
692
693using TexLevelMask = angle::BitSet<IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_TEXTURE_LEVELS>;
694
695enum class ComponentType
696{
697 Float = 0,
698 Int = 1,
699 UnsignedInt = 2,
700 NoType = 3,
701 EnumCount = 4,
702 InvalidEnum = 4,
703};
704
705constexpr ComponentType GLenumToComponentType(GLenum componentType)
706{
707 switch (componentType)
708 {
709 case GL_FLOAT:
710 return ComponentType::Float;
711 case GL_INT:
712 return ComponentType::Int;
713 case GL_UNSIGNED_INT:
714 return ComponentType::UnsignedInt;
715 case GL_NONE:
716 return ComponentType::NoType;
717 default:
718 return ComponentType::InvalidEnum;
719 }
720}
721
722constexpr angle::PackedEnumMap<ComponentType, uint32_t> kComponentMasks = {{
723 {ComponentType::Float, 0x10001},
724 {ComponentType::Int, 0x00001},
725 {ComponentType::UnsignedInt, 0x10000},
726}};
727
728constexpr size_t kMaxComponentTypeMaskIndex = 16;
729using ComponentTypeMask = angle::BitSet<kMaxComponentTypeMaskIndex * 2>;
730
731ANGLE_INLINE void SetComponentTypeMask(ComponentType type, size_t index, ComponentTypeMask *mask)
732{
733 ASSERT(index <= kMaxComponentTypeMaskIndex);
734 *mask &= ~(0x10001 << index);
735 *mask |= kComponentMasks[type] << index;
736}
737
738ANGLE_INLINE ComponentType GetComponentTypeMask(const ComponentTypeMask &mask, size_t index)
739{
740 ASSERT(index <= kMaxComponentTypeMaskIndex);
741 uint32_t mask_bits = static_cast<uint32_t>((mask.to_ulong() >> index) & 0x10001);
742 switch (mask_bits)
743 {
744 case 0x10001:
745 return ComponentType::Float;
746 case 0x00001:
747 return ComponentType::Int;
748 case 0x10000:
749 return ComponentType::UnsignedInt;
750 default:
751 return ComponentType::InvalidEnum;
752 }
753}
754
755bool ValidateComponentTypeMasks(unsigned long outputTypes,
756 unsigned long inputTypes,
757 unsigned long outputMask,
758 unsigned long inputMask);
759
760enum class RenderToTextureImageIndex
761{
762 // The default image of the texture, where data is expected to be.
763 Default = 0,
764
765 // Intermediate multisampled images for EXT_multisampled_render_to_texture.
766 // These values must match log2(SampleCount).
767 IntermediateImage2xMultisampled = 1,
768 IntermediateImage4xMultisampled = 2,
769 IntermediateImage8xMultisampled = 3,
770 IntermediateImage16xMultisampled = 4,
771
772 // We currently only support up to 16xMSAA in backends that use this enum.
773 InvalidEnum = 5,
774 EnumCount = 5,
775};
776
777template <typename T>
778using RenderToTextureImageMap = angle::PackedEnumMap<RenderToTextureImageIndex, T>;
779
780struct ContextID
781{
782 uint32_t value;
783};
784
785inline bool operator==(ContextID lhs, ContextID rhs)
786{
787 return lhs.value == rhs.value;
788}
789
790inline bool operator!=(ContextID lhs, ContextID rhs)
791{
792 return lhs.value != rhs.value;
793}
794
795inline bool operator<(ContextID lhs, ContextID rhs)
796{
797 return lhs.value < rhs.value;
798}
799
800constexpr size_t kCubeFaceCount = 6;

802template <typename T>
803using TextureTypeMap = angle::PackedEnumMap<TextureType, T>;
804using TextureMap = TextureTypeMap<BindingPointer<Texture>>;

806// ShaderVector can contain one item per shader. It differs from ShaderMap in that the values are
807// not indexed by ShaderType.
808template <typename T>
809using ShaderVector = angle::FixedVector<T, static_cast<size_t>(ShaderType::EnumCount)>;
810
811template <typename T>
812using AttachmentArray = std::array<T, IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENTS>;
813
814template <typename T>
815using AttachmentVector = angle::FixedVector<T, IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENTS>;
816
817using AttachmentsMask = angle::BitSet<IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENTS>;
818
819template <typename T>
820using DrawBuffersArray = std::array<T, IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS>;
821
822template <typename T>
823using DrawBuffersVector = angle::FixedVector<T, IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS>;
824
825template <typename T>
826using AttribArray = std::array<T, MAX_VERTEX_ATTRIBS>;
827
828using ActiveTextureMask = angle::BitSet<IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_ACTIVE_TEXTURES>;
829
830template <typename T>
831using ActiveTextureArray = std::array<T, IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_ACTIVE_TEXTURES>;
832
833using ActiveTextureTypeArray = ActiveTextureArray<TextureType>;
834
835template <typename T>
836using UniformBuffersArray = std::array<T, IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS>;
837template <typename T>
838using StorageBuffersArray = std::array<T, IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_SHADER_STORAGE_BUFFER_BINDINGS>;
839template <typename T>
840using AtomicCounterBuffersArray = std::array<T, IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_ATOMIC_COUNTER_BUFFERS>;
841using AtomicCounterBufferMask = angle::BitSet<IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_ATOMIC_COUNTER_BUFFERS>;
842template <typename T>
843using ImagesArray = std::array<T, IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_IMAGE_UNITS>;
844
845using ImageUnitMask = angle::BitSet<IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_IMAGE_UNITS>;
846
847using SupportedSampleSet = std::set<GLuint>;
848
849template <typename T>
850using TransformFeedbackBuffersArray =
851 std::array<T, gl::IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFERS>;
852
853constexpr size_t kBarrierVectorDefaultSize = 16;
854
855template <typename T>
856using BarrierVector = angle::FastVector<T, kBarrierVectorDefaultSize>;

858using BufferBarrierVector = BarrierVector<Buffer *>;

860struct TextureAndLayout
861{
862 Texture *texture;
863 GLenum layout;

865using TextureBarrierVector = BarrierVector<TextureAndLayout>;
866
867// OffsetBindingPointer.getSize() returns the size specified by the user, which may be larger than
868// the size of the bound buffer. This function reduces the returned size to fit the bound buffer if
869// necessary. Returns 0 if no buffer is bound or if integer overflow occurs.
870GLsizeiptr GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(const OffsetBindingPointer<Buffer> &binding);
871
872// A texture level index.
873template <typename T>
874class LevelIndexWrapper
875{
876 public:
877 LevelIndexWrapper() = default;
878 explicit constexpr LevelIndexWrapper(T levelIndex) : mLevelIndex(levelIndex) {}
879 constexpr LevelIndexWrapper(const LevelIndexWrapper &other) = default;
880 constexpr LevelIndexWrapper &operator=(const LevelIndexWrapper &other) = default;
881
882 constexpr T get() const { return mLevelIndex; }
883
884 LevelIndexWrapper &operator++()
885 {
886 ++mLevelIndex;
887 return *this;
888 }
889 constexpr bool operator<(const LevelIndexWrapper &other) const
890 {
891 return mLevelIndex < other.mLevelIndex;
892 }
893 constexpr bool operator<=(const LevelIndexWrapper &other) const
894 {
895 return mLevelIndex <= other.mLevelIndex;
896 }
897 constexpr bool operator>(const LevelIndexWrapper &other) const
898 {
899 return mLevelIndex > other.mLevelIndex;
900 }
901 constexpr bool operator>=(const LevelIndexWrapper &other) const
902 {
903 return mLevelIndex >= other.mLevelIndex;
904 }
905 constexpr bool operator==(const LevelIndexWrapper &other) const
906 {
907 return mLevelIndex == other.mLevelIndex;
908 }
909 constexpr bool operator!=(const LevelIndexWrapper &other) const
910 {
911 return mLevelIndex != other.mLevelIndex;
912 }
913 constexpr LevelIndexWrapper operator+(T other) const
914 {
915 return LevelIndexWrapper(mLevelIndex + other);
916 }
917 constexpr LevelIndexWrapper operator-(T other) const
918 {
919 return LevelIndexWrapper(mLevelIndex - other);
920 }
921 constexpr T operator-(LevelIndexWrapper other) const { return mLevelIndex - other.mLevelIndex; }
922
923 private:
924 T mLevelIndex;
925};
926
927// A GL texture level index.
928using LevelIndex = LevelIndexWrapper<GLint>;
929
930enum class MultisamplingMode
931{
932 // Regular multisampling
933 Regular = 0,
934 // GL_EXT_multisampled_render_to_texture renderbuffer/texture attachments which perform implicit
935 // resolve of multisampled data.
936 MultisampledRenderToTexture,
937};
938} // namespace gl
939
940namespace rx
941{
942// A macro that determines whether an object has a given runtime type.
943#if defined(__clang__)
944# if __has_feature(cxx_rtti)
945# define ANGLE_HAS_DYNAMIC_CAST 1
946# endif
947#elif !defined(NDEBUG) && (!defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(_CPPRTTI)) && \
948 (!defined(__GNUC__) || __GNUC__ < 4 || (__GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 3) || \
949 defined(__GXX_RTTI))
950# define ANGLE_HAS_DYNAMIC_CAST 1
951#endif
952
953#ifdef ANGLE_HAS_DYNAMIC_CAST
954# define ANGLE_HAS_DYNAMIC_TYPE(type, obj) (dynamic_cast<type>(obj) != nullptr)
955# undef ANGLE_HAS_DYNAMIC_CAST
956#else
957# define ANGLE_HAS_DYNAMIC_TYPE(type, obj) (obj != nullptr)
958#endif
959
960// Downcast a base implementation object (EG TextureImpl to TextureD3D)
961template <typename DestT, typename SrcT>
962inline DestT *GetAs(SrcT *src)
963{
964 ASSERT(ANGLE_HAS_DYNAMIC_TYPE(DestT *, src));
965 return static_cast<DestT *>(src);
966}
967
968template <typename DestT, typename SrcT>
969inline const DestT *GetAs(const SrcT *src)
970{
971 ASSERT(ANGLE_HAS_DYNAMIC_TYPE(const DestT *, src));
972 return static_cast<const DestT *>(src);
973}
974
975#undef ANGLE_HAS_DYNAMIC_TYPE
976
977// Downcast a GL object to an Impl (EG gl::Texture to rx::TextureD3D)
978template <typename DestT, typename SrcT>
979inline DestT *GetImplAs(SrcT *src)
980{
981 return GetAs<DestT>(src->getImplementation());
982}
983
984template <typename DestT, typename SrcT>
985inline DestT *SafeGetImplAs(SrcT *src)
986{
987 return src != nullptr ? GetAs<DestT>(src->getImplementation()) : nullptr;
988}
989
990} // namespace rx
991
992#include "angletypes.inc"
993
994namespace angle
995{
996// Zero-based for better array indexing
997enum FramebufferBinding
998{
999 FramebufferBindingRead = 0,
1000 FramebufferBindingDraw,
1001 FramebufferBindingSingletonMax,
1002 FramebufferBindingBoth = FramebufferBindingSingletonMax,
1003 FramebufferBindingMax,
1004 FramebufferBindingUnknown = FramebufferBindingMax,
1005};
1006
1007inline FramebufferBinding EnumToFramebufferBinding(GLenum enumValue)
1008{
1009 switch (enumValue)
1010 {
1011 case GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER:
1012 return FramebufferBindingRead;
1013 case GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER:
1014 return FramebufferBindingDraw;
1015 case GL_FRAMEBUFFER:
1016 return FramebufferBindingBoth;
1017 default:
1018 UNREACHABLE();
1019 return FramebufferBindingUnknown;
1020 }
1021}
1022
1023inline GLenum FramebufferBindingToEnum(FramebufferBinding binding)
1024{
1025 switch (binding)
1026 {
1027 case FramebufferBindingRead:
1028 return GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER;
1029 case FramebufferBindingDraw:
1030 return GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER;
1031 case FramebufferBindingBoth:
1032 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER;
1033 default:
1034 UNREACHABLE();
1035 return GL_NONE;
1036 }
1037}
1038
1039template <typename ObjT, typename ContextT>
1040class DestroyThenDelete
1041{
1042 public:
1043 DestroyThenDelete(const ContextT *context) : mContext(context) {}
1044
1045 void operator()(ObjT *obj)
1046 {
1047 (void)(obj->onDestroy(mContext));
1048 delete obj;
1049 }
1050
1051 private:
1052 const ContextT *mContext;
1053};
1054
1055// Helper class for wrapping an onDestroy function.
1056template <typename ObjT, typename DeleterT>
1057class UniqueObjectPointerBase : angle::NonCopyable
1058{
1059 public:
1060 template <typename ContextT>
1061 UniqueObjectPointerBase(const ContextT *context) : mObject(nullptr), mDeleter(context)
1062 {}
1063
1064 template <typename ContextT>
1065 UniqueObjectPointerBase(ObjT *obj, const ContextT *context) : mObject(obj), mDeleter(context)
1066 {}
1067
1068 ~UniqueObjectPointerBase()
1069 {
1070 if (mObject)
1071 {
1072 mDeleter(mObject);
1073 }
1074 }
1075
1076 ObjT *operator->() const { return mObject; }
1077
1078 ObjT *release()
1079 {
1080 auto obj = mObject;
1081 mObject = nullptr;
1082 return obj;
1083 }
1084
1085 ObjT *get() const { return mObject; }
1086
1087 void reset(ObjT *obj)
1088 {
1089 if (mObject)
1090 {
1091 mDeleter(mObject);
1092 }
1093 mObject = obj;
1094 }
1095
1096 private:
1097 ObjT *mObject;
1098 DeleterT mDeleter;
1099};
1100
1101template <typename ObjT, typename ContextT>
1102using UniqueObjectPointer = UniqueObjectPointerBase<ObjT, DestroyThenDelete<ObjT, ContextT>>;
1103
1104} // namespace angle

1108class State;
